sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The baptized Turk, or, A narrative of the happy conversion of Signior Rigep Dandulo, the onely son of a silk merchant in the Isle of Tzio, from the delusions of that great impostor Mahomet, unto the Christian religion and of his admission unto baptism by Mr. Gunning at Excester-house Chappel the 8th of Novemb., 1657 / drawn up by Tho. Warmstry. Warmstry, Thomas, 1610-1665.
[16], 150 [i.e. 158] p.
Printed for J. Williams, T. Garthwait ... and Henry Marsh ..., London : 1658.
Error in paging: p. 97-158 misprinted 89-150. Reproduction of original in the Union Theological Seminary Library, New York.
=======
